TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit CollectionEditor extends System.Drawing.Design.UITypeEditor

Docs.summary: Provides a user interface that can edit most types of collections at design time.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following code example uses an <xref:System.ComponentModel.EditorAttribute> to associate the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.CollectionEditor> with a property.
[!code-cpp[EditorAttributesExample#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/EditorAttributesExample/CPP/class1.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[EditorAttributesExample#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/EditorAttributesExample/CS/class1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[EditorAttributesExample#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/EditorAttributesExample/VB/class1.vb#1)]

block.para: This editor can edit collections that have an property. The editor can determine the type of the collection from the property, if it exists. If the collection does not have this property, or if you want to provide collections of more than one type, you can override certain protected members of this class to customize the editor to support other types of collections.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Type type) cil managed

Docs.param: The type of the collection for this editor to edit.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using the specified collection type.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance void CancelChanges() cil managed

Docs.summary: Cancels changes to the collection.

block.para: Override this method if you need to perform additional processing when changes to the collection are canceled.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance bool CanRemoveInstance(object value) cil managed

Docs.summary: Indicates whether original members of the collection can be removed.
Docs.returns: if it is permissible to remove this value from the collection; otherwise, . The default implementation always returns .

remarks.format:
## Remarks When implemented in a derived class, this method indicates whether the specified value can be removed from the collection. By default, this method always returns `true`.
This method is called when the user tries to remove an item that is an original member of the collection. This method is not called when removing items that were added in the current editing session because they are not yet part of the collection.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance bool CanSelectMultipleInstances() cil managed

Docs.summary: Indicates whether multiple collection items can be selected at once.
Docs.returns: if it multiple collection members can be selected at the same time; otherwise, . By default, this returns .

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method indicates whether multiple collection members can be selected within the collection editor dialog box.

Docs.summary: Gets the data type of each item in the collection.
Docs.value: The data type of the collection items.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property represents the data type of the items of the collection.

Docs.summary: Gets the data type of the collection object.
Docs.value: The data type of the collection object.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property represents the data type of the collection object.

Docs.summary: Gets a type descriptor that indicates the current context.
Docs.value: An that indicates the context currently in use, or if no context is available.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.ComponentModel.Design.CollectionEditor/CollectionForm CreateCollectionForm() cil managed

Docs.summary: Creates a new form to display and edit the current collection.
Docs.returns: A to provide as the user interface for editing the collection.

block.para: You can inherit from to provide your own form.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Type CreateCollectionItemType() cil managed

Docs.summary: Gets the data type that this collection contains.
Docs.returns: The data type of the items in the collection, or an if no property can be located on the collection.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You can retrieve the data type of the items of the collection from the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.CollectionEditor.CollectionItemType%2A> property, which is faster than this method.
This method does not need to be called by users, except in derived classes where this method has been overridden and implemented.
The default implementation of this method returns the data type of the `Item` property of the collection, if it exists.

block.para: Developers can choose to override this method to support collections that do not follow the typical and supported collection model, or when performance is critical, and reflection-based type resolution is too slow.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance object CreateInstance(class System.Type itemType) cil managed

Docs.param: The type of item to create.
Docs.summary: Creates a new instance of the specified collection item type.
Docs.returns: A new instance of the specified object.

block.para: This method should throw an exception if it cannot create a new instance of the specified type.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Type[] CreateNewItemTypes() cil managed

Docs.summary: Gets the data types that this collection editor can contain.
Docs.returns: An array of data types that this collection can contain.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You can retrieve the data type of the items of the collection from the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.CollectionEditor.NewItemTypes%2A> property, which is faster than this method.
This method does not need to be called by users, except in derived classes where this method has been overridden and implemented.
The default implementation of this method returns the type of all the collection items in a Type array.

block.para: This method must be overridden to support collections with multiple types. The default implementation of this method returns the data type of the property of the collection, if it exists. Use this method to override the default implementation.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance void DestroyInstance(object instance) cil managed

Docs.summary: Destroys the specified instance of the object.

MemberSignature.Value: public override object EditValue (System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext context, IServiceProvider provider, object value);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance object EditValue(class System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext context, class System.IServiceProvider provider, object value) cil managed

Docs.param: An that can be used to gain additional context information.
A service provider object through which editing services can be obtained.
The object to edit the value of.
Docs.summary: Edits the value of the specified object using the specified service provider and context.
Docs.returns: The new value of the object. If the value of the object has not changed, this should return the same object it was passed.
Docs.exception: An attempt to check out a file that is checked into a source code management program did not succeed.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance string GetDisplayText(object value) cil managed

Docs.param: The list item for which to retrieve display text.
Docs.summary: Retrieves the display text for the given list item.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance valuetype System.Drawing.Design.UITypeEditorEditStyle GetEditStyle(class System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext context) cil managed

Docs.param: An that can be used to gain additional context information.
Docs.summary: Gets the edit style used by the method.
Docs.returns: A enumeration value indicating the provided editing style. If the method is not supported in the specified context, this method will return the identifier.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance object[] GetItems(object editValue) cil managed

Docs.summary: Gets an array of objects containing the specified collection.
Docs.returns: An array containing the collection objects, or an empty object array if the specified collection does not inherit from .

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Collections.IList GetObjectsFromInstance(object instance) cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns a list containing the given object
Docs.returns: An which contains the individual objects to be created.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig instance object GetService(class System.Type serviceType) cil managed

Docs.param: The type of service to retrieve.
Docs.summary: Gets the requested service, if it is available.
Docs.returns: An instance of the service, or if the service cannot be found.

Docs.summary: Gets the Help keyword to display the Help topic or topic list for when the editor's dialog box Help button or the F1 key is pressed.
Docs.value: The Help keyword to display the Help topic or topic list for when Help is requested from the editor.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Override this property to display a different Help topic.

Docs.summary: Gets the available types of items that can be created for this collection.
Docs.value: The types of items that can be created.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property indicates the data types that can be added to the collection. By default, this returns a single type of <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.CollectionEditor.CollectionItemType%2A>. If more than one type is returned, the collection editor UI provides a way to choose which item type to create.

MemberSignature.Value: protected virtual object SetItems (object editValue, object[] value);
.method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance object SetItems(object editValue, object[] value) cil managed

Docs.param: An array of objects to set as the collection items.
Docs.summary: Sets the specified array as the items of the collection.
Docs.returns: The newly created collection object or, otherwise, the collection indicated by the parameter.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If setting requires that a new object be created, the new object is returned. Otherwise, the `editValue` parameter is returned.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance void ShowHelp() cil managed

Docs.summary: Displays the default Help topic for the collection editor.
